page.title: 06SCHOOLING
page.content: In all the villages surrounding Spaldwick there were very small schools,but as the population grew,it was decided that they would close ,and a new school would be built. .A primary school was built in Spaldwick,and the children from seven villages attend.The school,when it was built,had only three classrooms though now it has four and new buildings are being added.There is a large playground on which the children can play,and a field with a football pitch. When children are at secondary school age,they are sent to Hinchingbrooke ,a large comprehensive school in Huntingdon,approximately seven miles away.As most children live outside our village,transport is provided to and from Spaldwick.
